name: Collections
description:
As a hacker who likes to structure content
I want to be able to create collections of similar information
And render them

I have a configuration file with "collections" set to "['methods']"

I should see "Collections:

Use Jekyll.configuration to build a full configuration for use w/Jekyll.

Whatever: foo.bar

Signs are nice

Jekyll.sanitized_path is used to make sure your path is in your source.

Run your generators! default

Page without title.

Run your generators! default

" in "_site/index.html"

arguments.val:

Use Jekyll.configuration to build a full configuration for use w/Jekyll.

Whatever: foo.bar

Signs are nice

Jekyll.sanitized_path is used to make sure your path is in your source.

Run your generators! default

Page without title.

Run your generators! default

collections:

    output: true
    foo:   bar

name: Data
description:
In order to use well-formatted data in my blog
As a blog's user
I want to use _data directory in my site

- name: salt

name: Hooks
description:
As a plugin author
I want to be able to run code during various stages of the build process

elements.name: Run some code after site reset

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

elements.name: Modify the payload before rendering the site

steps.name: I have a "index.html" page that contains "{{ site.injected }}!"
I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

elements.name: Modify the site contents after reading

steps.name: I have a "page1.html" page that contains "page1"
I have a "page2.html" page that contains "page2"
I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

elements.name: Work with the site files after they've been written to disk

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :site, :post_write do |site|
  firstpage = site.pages.first
  content = File.read firstpage.destination(site.dest)
  File.write(File.join(site.dest, 'firstpage.html'), content)
end

steps.name: I have a "page1.html" page that contains "page1"

elements.name: Alter a page right after it is initialized

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:
I have a "page1.html" page that contains "page1"

elements.name: Alter the payload for one page but not another

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :pre_render do |page, payload|
  payload['myparam'] = 'special' if page.name == 'page1.html'
end

steps.name: I have a "page1.html" page that contains "{{ myparam }}"
I have a "page2.html" page that contains "{{ myparam }}"

elements.name: Modify page contents before writing to disk

steps.name: I have a "index.html" page that contains "WRAP ME"
I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:
I should see "{{{{{ WRAP ME }}}}}" in "_site/index.html"

elements.name: Work with a page after writing it to disk

steps.name: I have a "index.html" page that contains "HELLO FROM A PAGE"
I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :post_write do |page|
  require 'fileutils'
  filename = page.destination(page.site.dest)
  FileUtils.mv(filename, "#{filename}.moved")
end

steps.name: I should see "HELLO FROM A PAGE" in "_site/index.html.moved"

elements.name: Alter a post right after it is initialized

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:
I should see "pbagrag sbe ragel1." in "_site/2015/03/14/entry1.html"

elements.name: Alter the payload for certain posts

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
# Add myvar = 'old' to posts before 2015-03-15, and myvar = 'new' for
# others
Jekyll::Hooks.register :post, :pre_render do |post, payload|
  if post.date < Time.new(2015, 3, 15)
    payload['myvar'] = 'old'
  else
    payload['myvar'] = 'new'
  end
end

elements.name: Modify post contents before writing to disk

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
# Replace content after rendering
Jekyll::Hooks.register :post, :post_render do |post|
  post.output.gsub! /42/, 'the answer to life, the universe and everything'
end

steps.name: I should see "the answer to life, the universe and everything" in "_site/2015/03/14/entry1.html"

arguments.val: the answer to life, the universe and everything

elements.name: Work with a post after writing it to disk

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
# Log all post filesystem writes
Jekyll::Hooks.register :post, :post_write do |post|
  filename = post.destination(post.site.dest)
  open('_site/post-build.log', 'a') do |f|
    f.puts "Wrote #{filename} at #{Time.now}"
  end
end

elements.name: Register a hook on multiple owners at the same time

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:
I have a "index.html" page that contains "WRAP ME"
I should see "{{{{{ WRAP ME }}}}}" in "_site/index.html"

elements.name: Allow hooks to have a named priority

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :post_render, priority: :normal do |owner|
  # first normal runs second
  owner.output = "1 #{owner.output.chomp}"
end
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :post_render, priority: :high do |owner|
  # high runs last
  owner.output = "2 #{owner.output.chomp}"
end
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :post_render do |owner|
  # second normal runs third (normal is default)
  owner.output = "3 #{owner.output.chomp}"
end
Jekyll::Hooks.register :page, :post_render, priority: :low do |owner|
  # low runs first
  owner.output = "4 #{owner.output.chomp}"
end

steps.name: I have a "index.html" page that contains "WRAP ME"
I should see "2 3 1 4 WRAP ME" in "_site/index.html"

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :document, :pre_render do |doc, payload|
  doc.data['text'] = doc.data['text'] << ' are belong to us'
end

elements.name: Perform an action after every document is written

steps.name: I have a "_plugins/ext.rb" file with content:

doc_string.value:
Jekyll::Hooks.register :document, :post_write do |doc|
  open('_site/document-build.log', 'a') do |f|
    f.puts "Wrote document #{doc.collection.docs.index doc} at #{Time.now}"
  end
end

name: Site data
description:
As a hacker who likes to blog
I want to be able to embed data into my site
In order to make the site slightly dynamic
